sorular.soru: Are you driving in the correct lane at this point if you want to turn right?
cevaplar: No. You must use the right-most lane wherever possible.
Only buses are allowed to turn right here.
Yes. You are not allowed to drive on the rightmost lane here yet.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. You are not allowed to drive on the rightmost lane here yet.

feedback.metin: Bus lanes marked with the word "BUS" may only be used by public buses or coaches. If marked with the word "LIJNBUS", the lane may only be used by public buses. Drivers may not pre-sort or drive on a bus lane. You are therefore driving in the correct lane. As soon as the bus lane changes into a pre-sorting lane, you may move to the right.

sorular.soru: What is meant by unladen weight?
cevaplar: The weight in running order reduced by 100 kg.
The weight of the passenger car without load.
The maximum authorised mass without the load.
sorular.dogruCevap: The weight in running order reduced by 100 kg.

feedback.metin: The unladen weight is the weight in running order reduced by 100 kg. The weight of a passenger car's running order is the sum of the passenger vehicle without load, the fuel tank filled to 90%, a driver weighing 75 kg, all fluids and lubricants, and the standard equipment such as the spare wheel, jack, and tools.

sorular.soru: Do you have to turn right here?

feedback.metin: In this situation, you do not have to turn right. The sign shows a detour route. You are not required to follow this detour.

sorular.soru: The visibility is under 50 metres due to rain. Is the use of rear fog lights allowed?

feedback.metin: Using the rear fog light is only allowed in fog or snowfall when visibility is less than 50 metres. The rear fog light should never be used in the rain, because the light may blind other road users.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: A person using a walker, a stick, or crutches is considered a 'person with reduced mobility'. It is mandatory to give way to people with reduced mobility when crossing the road, even if they are not using a pedestrian crossing. If a person is using a wheelchair or disabled vehicle, this rule does not apply.

sorular.soru: Where are horse riders allowed to ride here?
cevaplar: In the verge or on the carriageway.
sorular.dogruCevap: In the verge or on the carriageway.

feedback.metin: Horse riders are required to use the bridle path. If none is present, they may use the verge or the carriageway.

sorular.soru: What should you do if you are blinded by the full-beam headlights of an oncoming vehicle?
cevaplar: Warn them by flashing your full-beam headlights.
Warn them with a sound signal.
Warn them with your hazard lights.
sorular.dogruCevap: Warn them by flashing your full-beam headlights.

feedback.metin: Full-beam headlights are only allowed at night, but they must not obstruct other traffic. Using full-beam headlights during the day, when encountering other traffic, or when travelling behind other vehicles at a short distance is not allowed. If an oncoming vehicle is using full-beam headlights and blinds you, warn the driver by flashing your own full-beam.

sorular.soru: You want to turn around on this intersection. Who should you give way to?

feedback.metin: Turning around falls under the special manoeuvres. When executing special manoeuvres you must give way to all other traffic, so all road users.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to drive like this. The passenger vehicle is raised at the back by the caravan. This means that there is a negative drawbar load (ball pressure). This is prohibited and very dangerous.

sorular.soru: What should you take into account in this situation?
cevaplar: That the steering lock can be on and the power steering and power brakes are absent.
That the distance between the vehicles must be no less than five metres.
Do not leave the tow rope taut all the time while driving.
sorular.dogruCevap: That the steering lock can be on and the power steering and power brakes are absent.

feedback.metin: Towing another vehicle is best limited to emergencies; if you can arrange something else this is always preferable. When towing another vehicle, you must ensure that the vehicles are never more than 5 metres apart. Less than 5 metres apart is allowed. You must also try to keep the tow rope as tight as possible. Power steering and power brakes often do not work when a vehicle is being towed. Also, make sure that the steering lock is not on. This can happen when the ignition is off.

sorular.soru: Which vehicles have a blue number plate?

feedback.metin: Taxis and snorfietsen have a blue number plate. Commercial vehicles have a green number plate and mopeds a yellow one.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive a trailer with a defective rear light?
cevaplar: Yes. Because the trailer also has retro-reflectors.
No. All mandatory lighting must always work properly.
Yes. As long as you do not drive in the dark.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. All mandatory lighting must always work properly.

feedback.metin: The mandatory lighting of a trailer must work properly. The lamps must be properly attached to the trailer and the covers must not be damaged or missing. If that is the case, you are not allowed to drive the trailer.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the car?

feedback.metin: It is too foggy to see if oncoming traffic is approaching. It is not safe to overtake here and it is therefore prohibited.

sorular.soru: The train has passed. Is driving onwards allowed?

feedback.metin: Only when the red light is off, you may cross the level crossing. You can see by the double Andreas cross that the level crossing consists of two or more tracks. After a train has passed, a second train can also come from the opposite direction.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit for a moped rider on a cycle/moped path outside built-up areas?

feedback.metin: The speed limit for a moped rider on the road is 45 km/h. On cycle/moped paths outside built-up areas, the speed limit is 40 km/h and on cycle/moped paths inside built-up areas, it is 30 km/h.

sorular.soru: Can you drop off a passenger here?
cevaplar: No, parking and waiting are forbidden here.
Yes. Waiting is prohibited here, but parking is allowed.
Yes. Parking is prohibited here, but waiting is allowed.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, parking and waiting are forbidden here.

feedback.metin: A solid yellow line indicates that you are not allowed to park or wait here. Picking up and dropping off passengers or loading and unloading goods is also forbidden. You are allowed to do this in case of a broken yellow line.

sorular.soru: What is the main reason for adjusting the headrest?
cevaplar: To prevent head and neck injuries as much as possible in the event of a collision.
To sit as comfortably as possible so that you can drive safely.
To ensure that the seat belt works optimally.
sorular.dogruCevap: To prevent head and neck injuries as much as possible in the event of a collision.

feedback.metin: The headrests must be correctly adjusted for each occupant of the vehicle. The top of the headrest should be equal to the top of the head and should be as close as possible to the head. This is the best way to avoid head and neck injuries in the event of a collision. The way the seat belt functions is unaffected regardless of how the headrest is adjusted.

sorular.soru: What do you do when it has snowed?
cevaplar: Increase your speed as much as possible.
Reduce your following distance as much as possible.

feedback.metin: When it starts snowing, you first reduce your speed and increase your following distance. Look far ahead so you can react in time. Pull up slowly, drive at the lowest possible speed and try to brake as little as possible.

sorular.soru: What traffic behaviour is expected of you here?
cevaplar: Drive faster to leave more space behind you.
Stay calm and go to the right if possible.
Brake lightly to scare the tailgater.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stay calm and go to the right if possible.

feedback.metin: Tailgating is prohibited. If someone is tailgating you, stay calm and maintain your speed, and keep to the right if possible. Do not use your brakes to warn or scare the tailgater. If this results in an accident, you will face criminal prosecution.

sorular.soru: What influences the braking distance?

feedback.metin: Braking distance refers to the distance a vehicle travels while braking. Braking distance depends on the initial speed and the deceleration. The higher the speed, the longer the braking distance. When the speed doubles, the braking distance quadruples. Thinking time has no influence on braking distance. When you start braking, you have already reacted.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the coach?
cevaplar: No. Because the bus is on the right-hand side of a solid line.
No. The coach driver is performing a special manoeuvre.
Yes. This coach driver is indicating that they want to pull away from the bus stop.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. This coach driver is indicating that they want to pull away from the bus stop.

feedback.metin: In built-up areas, you must allow bus drivers, including coaches, to pull away from bus stops when they indicate as such. This rule only applies if the bus driver uses their indicator and only within built-up areas.

sorular.soru: You want to transport three children on this back seat for a children's party. Is that allowed?

feedback.metin: You are required to use your seat belts, also on the back seat. In addition, there may not be more people in the car than there are seat belts present. This back seat only has two seat belts. Only a maximum of two people may be transported on this seat.

sorular.soru: Should you cooperate at an alcohol checkpoint?

feedback.metin: If a competent official stops you, such as a police officer, you must cooperate with an alcohol check. This also applies if you have not had anything to drink. If you do not cooperate with a breath, blood or urine test, the police are required to confiscate your driving licence.

sorular.soru: Is this sign indicating a speed limit?

feedback.metin: The sign means: recommended speed. Here it is advised not to go faster than 50 km/h. It is not a speed limit. Driving faster is not forbidden, but the sign is there for a reason.

sorular.soru: Are drivers of a brommobiel allowed to drive here?

feedback.metin: The C-15 sign means: Closed to bicycles, mopeds, and disabled vehicles. Roads, where the C-15 sign is placed, are also closed to snorfietsen and speed pedelecs. The sign does not apply to drivers of a brommobiel. They are allowed to drive here.

sorular.soru: What is this sign warning you of?

feedback.metin: The J-1 sign warns of a poor road surface. Reduce your speed as much as possible.

sorular.soru: Can you stop here momentarily to adjust your navigation system?

feedback.metin: Stopping at a lay-by next to an autoweg to adjust a navigation system is prohibited. You may only use a lay-by in the event of an emergency.

sorular.soru: Does driving a caravan increase fuel consumption?

feedback.metin: The passenger car must move not only its own weight, but also the weight of the caravan. In addition, the air resistance increases.

sorular.soru: Where can you stop to pick up or drop off a passenger?
cevaplar: At a bus stop next to the blocked marking.
sorular.dogruCevap: At a bus stop next to the blocked marking.

feedback.metin: You may only stop at bus stops on the blocked marking to pick up or drop off passengers. Stopping at a solid yellow line or on the carriageway next to a bus lane is prohibited.

sorular.soru: Where does it say when your car is required to be re-inspected for the APK?

feedback.metin: Cars must be inspected periodically. The first inspection after purchase for petrol and hybrid cars takes place after 4 years. For diesel cars this is after 3 years. Then, petrol and hybrid cars must be inspected after two years, this happens twice and after that every year. Diesel cars must be inspected every year after the first inspection. The date before which the car must be re-examined is stated on the inspection certificate.

sorular.soru: Is driving at a speed of 100 km/h allowed here?

feedback.metin: The G-4 sign indicates the end of an autoweg. A speed limit of 80 km/h applies to all roads outside built-up areas unless otherwise indicated by signage.

sorular.soru: You are driving with daytime running lights. Is this allowed?

feedback.metin: In a tunnel you have to use your dipped headlights. Daytime running lights is not enough. Turn on your dipped headlights well before entering the tunnel.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake this lorry?

feedback.metin: You are allowed to overtake this lorry. The sign indicates that lorries are not allowed to overtake motor vehicles. A passenger car is allowed to overtake.

sorular.soru: Is a fire extinguisher part of the legally required equipment in a car?

feedback.metin: A fire extinguisher is not a legal requirement in the car but is recommended, as is a first aid kit.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake here?

feedback.metin: A solid white line indicates that you are not allowed to overtake. It does not matter whether there are one or two solid lines.

sorular.soru: Is this child being transported as safely as possible?

feedback.metin: This child is not being transported safely because the headrest of the child restraint system is too low. The top of the restraint should be at the same level as the top of the child's head. Besides that, the shoulders should also fit comfortably under the headrest. This way the child restraint system can prevent serious head and neck injuries in the event of a collision.

sorular.soru: Should you give way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: The B-7 sign means: Stop and give right of way to drivers on the intersecting road. The sign indicates that you are required to stop. However, you do not have to give way to the pedestrian because they are not a driver on the intersecting road.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive if the windscreen defogger does not work properly?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to drive if the blower used to defrost or defog the windscreen is not working properly. You can then no longer defog your windscreen if necessary.

sorular.soru: The load protrudes 1.5 metres. Are you allowed to drive like this?
cevaplar: Yes. But only with a marking plate.
Yes. However, a marking plate is not mandatory.

feedback.metin: Divisible and indivisible loads may never protrude more than 1 metre from the back of a car. However, an indivisible load on a trailer may protrude more than 1 metre from the back. This does not apply to passenger cars.

sorular.soru: What do you do if this warning light stays on?
cevaplar: Do not turn off the engine and drive directly to the nearest garage.
Keep driving until the warning light goes out.
Stop in a safe place and call the breakdown service for advice.
sorular.dogruCevap: Stop in a safe place and call the breakdown service for advice.

feedback.metin: The battery light comes on every time you start the vehicle. Once you start driving, it should turn off automatically. If the battery light remains on, or suddenly lights up while you are driving, this means your battery is no longer being charged. This usually indicates a malfunctioning alternator, power cables, drive belt, or battery. Stop in a safe place as soon as possible and call the breakdown service or a garage for advice. In the past, drivers were advised to continue driving in this situation. In modern cars, however, continuing to drive is unwise as reduced battery voltage can result in the failure of important systems.

sorular.soru: What should you do first to help?
cevaplar: Ensure the safety of any victims.

feedback.metin: Ensure your own safety first at all times. Pay attention to potential hazards such as smoke, fire, and traffic. Try to determine how many victims there are and what their condition is. Avoid moving victims as this may exacerbate any injuries. Contact the emergency services by calling 112, before attending to any victims.
